Package org.thewhitemage13.handler

Class UserDeletedEventHandler

java.lang.Object
org.thewhitemage13.handler.UserDeletedEventHandler
@Component @KafkaListener(topics="user.deleted") public class UserDeletedEventHandler extends Object
Handles events related to a user being deleted.

This class listens for UserEvent messages from the Kafka topic "user.deleted" and processes them by deleting all posts associated with the deleted user. The class interacts with the PostServiceImpl to remove posts from the system.

The handler is marked as a KafkaListener, which means it will listen for events on the specified Kafka topic and invoke the appropriate method when a UserEvent is received.

Version:
1.0.0
Author:
Mukhammed Lolo

  • Constructor Details

    • UserDeletedEventHandler

      @Autowired public UserDeletedEventHandler(PostServiceImpl postServiceImpl)
      Constructs a new UserDeletedEventHandler with the specified PostServiceImpl.

      The constructor is annotated with @Autowired, which allows Spring to inject the PostServiceImpl dependency at runtime.

      Parameters:
      postServiceImpl - the service that manages posts, used to delete posts associated with a user

  • Method Details

    • userDeleted

      @KafkaHandler public void userDeleted(org.thewhitemage13.UserEvent userEvent) throws PostNotFoundException
      Handles the event when a user is deleted.

      This method is invoked when a UserEvent is received from the Kafka topic "user.deleted". It delegates the task of deleting all posts associated with the deleted user to the PostServiceImpl.

      Parameters:
      userEvent - the event containing the user's information, including the user ID
      Throws:
      PostNotFoundException - if an error occurs while attempting to delete posts associated with the user
